title: Trump Chief of Staff Meadows Gets Immunity in DC Election Probe
description: Mark Meadows, the final chief of staff to Donald Trump, has been given immunity from prosecution in the election-interference probe against the former president in Washington and has testified before a grand jury hearing evidence in the case, according to a person familiar.

title: Deficit Worries Making a Return as a 2024 Political Issue
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House reporter Michelle Jamrisko looks at the politics of budget deficits. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Latest GOP Speaker Nominee Emmer Ends Bid After Trump Criticism
description: Representative Tom Emmer dropped his bid for House speaker Tuesday after criticism from Donald Trump, becoming the third GOP nominee for the leadership post to be dragged down by seething divisions within the party.

title: US Lawmaker Seeks Shein Sanctions Over Use of Banned Cotton
description: A member of Congress who co-sponsored a law banning products from China’s Xinjiang region is asking a Department of Homeland Security task force to investigate fast-fashion retailer Shein and potentially ban it from the US.

title: Pentagon Set to Transfer Army’s Two Iron Dome Units to Israel
description: The Pentagon is sending Israel the US Army’s two batteries of Iron Dome radar, command posts and interceptors to boost the nation’s air defense.

title: Biden, Saudi Crown Prince Discuss Efforts to Contain Israeli-Hamas Conflict
description: President Joe Biden told Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman about US efforts to prevent the conflict between Hamas and Israel from escalating during a phone call Tuesday, the White House said in a statement.

title: Maduro Ally Says Venezuelan Opposition Violated Election Deal
description: A senior Venezuelan official accused the opposition of reporting an “inflated” number of votes in Sunday’s primary, thereby violating a deal that led to US sanctions being eased.

title: Israel Says Navy Stops Hamas Divers From Infiltrating South
description: Israeli naval forces attacked Hamas divers attempting to enter one of its evacuated southern communities by sea on Tuesday, the army spokesman’s office said.

title: How H-1B Visas Work and Why They’re Back in Headlines
description: Migrants who enter the US uninvited at the nation’s southern border dominate the political debate over immigration. But there’s a fight as well over tens of thousands of people who enter the US legally every year as part of a visa program, known as H-1B, largely designed to attract guest workers with science, math and computer skills. Technology and engineering companies say they need more of those workers, but they’ve faced opposition from critics on the political right and left who say the pro

title: Crypto, Pot Banking Would Gain Edge With Emmer as House Speaker
description: Crypto companies and marijuana advocates would gain powerful support if Republican Tom Emmer wins the House speakership.

title: Liberians to Pick Between Weah and Boakai in Nov. 14 Runoff Vote
description: Liberian leader George Weah  and Joseph Boakai, a former vice president, will contest a runoff election on Nov. 14 after this month’s vote failed to produce an outright winner of the nation’s top job.

title: Ukraine’s Army Enlists Russians Eager to Fight and Defeat Putin
description: Ukraine’s military has formed a battalion of soldiers made up entirely of Russian citizens who want to fight against President Vladimir Putin’s invasion.

title: Blinken Warns Iran of ‘Decisive’ Response If Americans Are Attacked
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken warned that the US would respond “decisively” if Iran or its proxies attack Americans, the sternest warning yet as the Biden administration tries to keep Tehran from joining the war between Israel and Hamas.

title: AMLO Threatens to Revoke Train Concessions on Passenger Dispute
description: Mexico’s government could revoke train concessions from companies that do not agree with its plans to establish passenger lines on existing freight routes, President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said Tuesday.

title: Nigeria Aims to Emulate OECD Nations in Tax Revenue Collection
description: The Nigerian government’s efforts to boost revenue will help reduce its loan-service ratio by almost a half in the medium-term, the head of the nation’s Debt Management Office said.

title: Canadians Blame Stores Most For Rising Food Prices, Poll Shows
description: More than a quarter of Canadians say profiteering by grocery chains is the top cause of high food costs, underscoring the political logic behind Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s public demands that stores stabilize prices.

title: Trump Criticizes GOP Speaker Nominee Emmer as ‘Tragic Mistake’
description: Tom Emmer

title: Airline CEOs Predict Loyalty Program Doom Under Proposed Legislation
description: The top executives of Delta Air Lines Inc. and United Airlines Holdings Inc. are warning that legislation pending in Congress would devastate popular loyalty programs.

title: China Engages in First US Farm-Goods Signing Ceremony in Six Years
description: Chinese grain companies participated in a formal contract-signing ceremony for the purchase of US farm goods for the first time since the Trump-era trade dispute.

title: Here’s What Trump Is Arguing in the DC Election Obstruction Case Against Him
description: Donald Trump rolled out a new, multi-pronged attack on the federal election obstruction case against him in Washington, arguing he’s a victim of “selective prosecution” by the Biden administration, that the indictment violates his free-speech rights, and that the charges in the indictment are legally unsound.

title: UN Chief Urges Halt Now by Both Sides in Israel-Hamas War
description: The United Nations secretary-general called on Israel and Hamas to immediately halt their war, saying the parties were killing and injuring civilians in violation of international law.

title: Trudeau Weighs Limits on Oil and Gas in Indigenous Resource Loan Plan
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his cabinet are planning a multibillion-dollar loan program to help Indigenous groups in Canada buy equity in resource projects. But the government is still debating whether to include the oil and gas sector within it.

title: J.B. Pritzker, Gavin Newsom Juice Biden’s Campaign Fundraising Efforts
description: President Joe Biden’s reelection fundraising operation has gotten a powerful assist from the nation’s Democratic governors, who have helped him amass a record $91 million war chest a year ahead of the presidential election.

title: Trump Lawyer Ellis Pleads Guilty in Georgia Election Case
description: State prosecutors in Atlanta secured a fourth guilty plea in their election fraud case against Donald Trump when attorney Jenna Ellis admitted she aided and abetted false statements relating to the former president’s efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

title: Emmer Expands Lead in Speaker Race as GOP Field Shrinks
description: House Republicans’ third-ranking leader Tom Emmer expanded his lead Tuesday for the speaker nomination over multiple ballots as lawmakers met to pick a new candidate after the party’s two previous choices failed to secure enough support to win the job.

title: Germany’s Habeck Urges More Support to Drive Industrial Revamp
UK to Scrap Bankers’ Bonus Cap in Competitiveness Push
description: The UK is going ahead with scrapping the cap on bankers’ bonuses, enforcing plans unveiled by Liz Truss’s government last year.

title: EU Raised Concerns With US Over Biden’s China Investment Order
description: The European Union has told the Biden administration it’s concerned that US restrictions on outbound investments aimed at China could hit companies in the bloc, adding yet another trade irritant to transatlantic ties.

title: Ukraine Sees Russian Cyberattacks Growing More Sophisticated
description: A senior Ukrainian official said Russian cyberattacks are growing more sophisticated and have become daily occurrences aimed at disrupting vital infrastructure during wartime.

title: Spain’s Sanchez Agrees to Cut Workweek to 37.5 Hours in Deal With Far Left
description: Spain’s Socialist Party and the far-left group Sumar agreed to cut weekly working hours as part of talks to try to form a coalition government.

title: Russia’s Seaborne Crude Exports Rise to a Four-Month High
description: Four-week average flows hit 3.5 million barrels a day

title: Ex-PM Sharif Gets Bail From Pakistan Graft Cases Before Polls
description: A Pakistan court granted bail to Nawaz Sharif for two graft convictions as the three-time former premier seeks to appeal against his jail sentences and move a step closer to contest in the national elections expected in January.

title: China Removes Li Shangfu as Defense Minister, CCTV Reports
description: China has removed Li Shangfu as defense minister, according to state broadcaster CCTV, the latest in a string of high-profile reshuffles in President Xi Jinping’s government that have spooked investors amid a fragile economic recovery.

title: Mixed Economic Signals, 12 Months Into Sunak's Leadership
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Lagarde Sees ECB’s Inflation Fight Going Well Ahead of Decision
description: European Central Bank chief Christine Lagarde reckons the fight against inflation is going well but the lack of a regional deal on fiscal rules is turning into a headache, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: China Names Lan Fo’an as Finance Minister to Tackle Debt Risks
description: China named Lan Fo’an as finance minister to replace Liu Kun, giving him responsibility for implementing a plan to diffuse local government debt risks.

title: EU to Fight ‘Paralysis’ on Emissions at COP28, Spain’s Ribera Says
description: Conflicts in Ukraine and the Middle East will make for difficult climate talks in Dubai, says Spain’s Environmental Transition Minister Teresa Ribera.

title: Israeli Flyers Dropped on Gaza Offer Cash for Intel on Hostages
description: The Israeli military began offering cash and protection for anyone who shares accurate information on the whereabouts of hostages held by militant group Hamas.

title: Morocco to Trim Subsidies as World Cup, Earthquake Take Toll
description: Morocco will start phasing out subsidies on cooking gas next year, a show of resolve by the cash-tight sovereign as it tries to balance hefty spending commitments arising from 2030’s football World Cup and an earthquake recovery.

title: DeSantis Will Set Out Foreign Policy Agenda in Washington Speech
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis will deliver a foreign policy address in Washington on Friday as the US confronts wars in Ukraine and Israel, according to a person familiar with his presidential campaign.

title: Israel Weighs Options and a Dilemma in Gaza
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Poland’s Opposition Presses President to Accelerate Power Handover
description: Poland’s pro-European opposition put forward Donald Tusk as their candidate for the premiership, intensifying pressure on the president to speed up a handover of power after the parties secured a majority in the Oct. 15 election.

title: Turkish Progress on Sweden’s NATO Bid Turns Spotlight on Hungary
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s decision to advance Sweden’s bid for membership of the NATO military alliance has turned the focus on Hungary.

title: Ukraine Recap: Zelenskiy to Speak With EU on Membership Bid
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will hold talks with the European Commission ahead of its expected decision to recommend opening accession talks with Kyiv, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Xi Makes Unprecedented PBOC Visit in Sign of Focus on Economy
description: Xi Jinping made his first known visit to the nation’s central bank since he became Chinese president a decade ago, according to people familiar with the matter, underscoring the government’s increased focus on shoring up the economy and financial markets.

title: Top Bond Investor Slams South Africa Bid to Fix State Firms
description: Futuregrowth Asset Management Ltd., a South African money manager overseeing more than 190 billion rand ($10 billion) of fixed-income assets, says the government’s draft legislation meant to address inefficiencies at state entities is “ineffective, overdue, vague, and contradictory”.

title: Macron Will Call on Israel to Revive Palestinian Peace Process
description: French President Emmanuel Macron will call for a revival of peace talks between Israel and the Palestinians during a visit to Tel Aviv on Tuesday.

title: More Foreign Investment in Mining Coming: Nigeria Summit
description: Nigeria’s government said it sees a jump in foreign direct investment in the mining industry as President Bola Tinubu’s government revamps the regulatory framework.

title: Nigeria to Tighten Rules to Curb Raw Mineral Exports
description: Nigeria plans to tighten rules to reduce the export of raw minerals and encourage the shipment of processed products, a moved aimed at creating jobs and boosting the value of its exports.

title: US State Senator Arrested in Hong Kong Airport Over Unloaded Gun
description: A senator from the US state of Washington was arrested on Friday night at Hong Kong International Airport over a gun in his carry-on bag, his office said.

title: Israel Latest: Macron Lands as Talks to Free Hostages Intensify
description: French President Emmanuel Macron becomes the latest world leader to visit Israel, where he’ll meet Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and is expected to call for the resumption of the Israeli-Palestinian peace process.

title: Five Things You Need to Know to Start Your Day
description: Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

title: Ex-Philippine Leader Duterte Sued by Lawmaker for Grave Threats
description: A Philippine lawmaker on Tuesday filed a criminal complaint against ex-President Rodrigo Duterte for what she described as a “serious threat” to her life, alleging that the former leader threatened to kill her during a TV interview this month.

title: US-China Economic Talks Start With First Working Group Meeting
description: US Treasury staff and counterparts from China held the first meeting of a new working group dedicated to discussing economic topics, yet another small sign of improving ties between the two powers.

title: House Republicans Plan Another Vote to Choose a New Speaker
description: House Republicans plan to try on Tuesday to choose a nominee for speaker after the party’s two previous candidates failed to secure enough support to win the job.
